message_1: What is the enthalpy of vaporization of ethylene glycol if it takes 255.8 J of energy to vaporize 10 grams of it at its boiling point of 197.3 Â°C? (Molar mass of ethylene glycol= 62.07 g/mol)
message_2:
To find the enthalpy of vaporization of ethylene glycol, we first need to determine the number of moles of ethylene glycol in the 10 grams sample.

Number of moles = mass / molar mass
Number of moles = 10 g / 62.07 g/mol = 0.1612 mol

Now, we can use the energy provided (255.8 J) to find the enthalpy of vaporization per mole.

Enthalpy of vaporization = energy / number of moles
Enthalpy of vaporization = 255.8 J / 0.1612 mol = 1586.6 J/mol

So, the enthalpy of vaporization of ethylene glycol is approximately 1586.6 J/mol.
